definition: to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: The Swedish experiment, to be frank, was a glorious failure.
sentences.chinese: 坦率地说，瑞典的实验虽败犹荣。

sentences.english: For the Chinese did not win more sad motherland proud assured.
sentences.chinese: 为中国没有获胜而伤心，更为祖国的虽败犹荣而自豪。

sentences.english: When the news of the failure came, all his friends said that it was a victorious defeat.
sentences.chinese: 当失败的消息传来，他所有的朋友都说他虽败犹荣。

definition: to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
to lose to (sb)/to be outdone by
(fig.) to fight a one-sided battle/to have an unfair advantage in a contest
lit. fight with one's back to the river (idiom); fig. to fight to win or die
to fight with all one's might
using the weak to defeat the strong (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
